import time

startTime = time.time()

JohnsKillCount = 0
# write your code or functions calls
for i in range(20000000):
    JohnsKillCount+=1

endTime = time.time()
totalTime = endTime - startTime

print("John killed",JohnsKillCount,"in" , totalTime,"seconds")
print()

#Using the decimal precision format
print('John killed {0} in {1:.2f} seconds'.format(JohnsKillCount,totalTime))

source.df2585f7:
BestHitman = 'Boggeyman'

def whoIsBestHitman():
    
    global BestHitman
    
    print("Best hitman was ",BestHitman)
    BestHitman = 'John Wick' 
    print("But now it is ",BestHitman)
    
whoIsBestHitman()

import itertools
test = [[-1, -2], [30, 40], [25, 35]]
print(list(itertools.chain.from_iterable(test)))

import more_itertools

test = [[-1, -2], [1, 2, 3, [4, (5, [6, 7])]], (30, 40), [25, 35]]

print(list(more_itertools.collapse(test)))

#-> [-1, -2, 30, 40, 25, 35]

source.fe8d4b82:
### 18. Global vs Local

Global variables are the one that are defined and declared outside a function and we need to use them inside a function. We only need to use the global keyword in a function if we want to do assignments / change them. global is not needed for printing and accessing.

John Wick knew this. That's why he was able to beat the Boogeyman. Boogeyman didn't know it.

source.c9841692:
# Introduction

Hi everyone!

Just trying out writing kernels for the first to help beginners; and to see how good it fares and improve my skills!
I decided to learn python exactly three months back and so, although I am not an expert, or even intermedaite for that matter, I think I did encounter many useful tools and tricks along the way.

So, here's to helping all those starting out!

I decided to add some memes, just to make reading this kernel a bit humorous. Really curious to see how it goes!
I'll link down the resouces, sites and discussions that helped me compile this kernel up at the end. 

So pick up the pencil, note down and Hope you enjoy this!

![](https://i.imgur.com/pk4IZSb.png)

source.bb3980ba:
### 37. Ordered Dictionary from collections
OrderedDict preserves the order in which the keys are inserted. A regular dict doesn’t track the insertion order, and iterating it gives the values in an arbitrary order and won't give ordered representation everytime. This is noticeable when the dict size is large.

# John Wick Chapter 1 : Easy

Legends speak of a man named John Wick. As the story goes, he was not a normal coder; the most brutal of them all. 

But John had humble beginings. He started like all of us; a mere mortal. 

Made popular only by the power of his pencil; taking notes one tip at a time, till he became the most feared.

source.a98f2f50:
# Thank you for reading!

Well, theres goes my first kernel!

I don't know how this will turn out. It has been some really dark days; internships getting cancelled, staring the screen, staying at home.

I decided to learn Python about 3 months back, and this lockdown has left me mentally exhausted to code and learn; so much so that I often end up compairing myself to other better Kagglers and pondering that I'ce probably not achieved much in life.

I had always heard everyone say, consistency and practice is all that matters, and I can clearly see why it's the hardest thing to do. Anyway, even though I was reluctant, I decided it's better to slow down instead of stopping, so even though reluctant, I tried switching to writing kernels just to ease things off.

**If you found this kernel helpful please consider upvoting it!**

![](https://i.imgur.com/PcPq7a9.png)
source.fe922d13:
### 36. DeafultDict() from collections
The functionality of both dictionaries and defualtdict are almost same except for the fact that defualtdict never raises a KeyError. It provides a default value for the key that does not exists.
source.6b8216e8:
### 44. Add row total and column total to a numerical dataframe

We'll try to append a column which has cumulative sum of a numerical row, and a row that has sum of numerical columns.
This can be useful for calculating overall scores, grades, etc. Although not very useful in this context, this dataset has enough numerical coulms for the sake of practice.
